comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Little Falls , NY was in the news in late 1912 for a textile workers strike. This could be associated with that. See, for example, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9901E1D61630E233A...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Swang: Could be. What do you make of the speaker's last name?  Caley or Calery?

comment.author: 8964737@N03
comment._content: That chap looks like he's carrying a set of chimney sweeping rods.

comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: There was a Phil Callery who was a socialist labor lawyer. The photo on this page: library.pittstate.edu/spcoll/ndxcallerys.html looks very much like the man speaking.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: j3net, I'd guess that you have the right guy.  I was definitely looking for socialists, but can't have tried that variation on the name.  Well done.
